alert.note: Alert for Clark; Finney; Ford; Gray; Haskell; Meade; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:52PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Ford, northeastern Seward, southwestern Finney, northern Meade, southern Gray, northwestern Clark and Haskell Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from near Plymell to near Montezuma, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tice and Copeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Finney; Ford; Gray; Haskell; Meade; Seward
